net.jxta.edutella.util
Class Configurator

java.lang.Object
  net.jxta.edutella.util.Configurator

public class Configurator
extends java.lang.Object

EduConfig is responsible for configuring objects from properties or command line arguments. Command line arguments have a higher precedence than property file entries.
The process works as follows:

  • An object that wants to be configured needs to implement the Configurable interface. Thus, is it able to provide information about which properties and command line switches it understands.
  • Each Configurable needs to be registered with the EduConfig object using register(net.jxta.edutella.util.Configurable).
  • After registering the objects, finishConfig is called, which configures all registered objects accordingly.
See Configurable for details on how objects register themselves.

Author:
schm4704@jxta.org

configureObject

public void configureObject(Configurable object)
Sets object attributes from properties. This method extracts the attribute names from the object BeanInfo and looks for properties with the same names. If the prefix argument is not empty, it looks for properties with name <prefix>.<attributename>. For all matching properties the attribute value is set using the setter methods. Finally the method init() is called on the object if it exists.

Parameters:
object - object to store
prefix - property name prefix

initObject

public void initObject(Configurable object)

retrieveObjectProperties

public void retrieveObjectProperties(java.lang.Object object,
                                     java.lang.String prefix)
Sets object attributes from properties. This method extracts the attribute names from the object BeanInfo and looks for properties with the same names. If the prefix argument is not empty, it looks for properties with name <prefix>.<attributename>. For all matching properties the attribute value is set using the setter methods. Finally the method init() is called on the object if it exists.

Parameters:
object - object to store
prefix - property name prefix

write

public void write(java.lang.String filename)
writes all options to a file.

Parameters:
filename - name of properties file

store

public void store(Configurable object)
Stores object attributes. This method extracts the attribute names from the object BeanInfo and sets properties using this names. If the prefix argument is not empty, it uses names of the form <prefix>.<attributename>. Note that to store the properties in a file you need to call @see write()

Parameters:
object - object to store
prefix - property name prefix

private void exit(java.lang.String message)
